bodylog.files.write

Class MoveSaver

  • java.lang.Object
    • bodylog.files.abstracts.Saver
      • bodylog.files.write.MoveSaver

  • public class MoveSaver
extends Saver
    Class for encapsulating the saving of a Move to file and editing files relating to a Move.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class bodylog.files.abstracts.Saver

        move, updater

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new MoveSaver for the specified Move and with the given updater.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveSaver

        public MoveSaver(MoveListContainerUpdater updater,
                 Move move)
        Creates a new MoveSaver for the specified Move and with the given updater.
        Parameters:
        updater - MoveListContainerUpdater used to inform MoveListContainers that a Move has been edited or created
        move - Move to be saved
        See Also:
        Move

    • Method Detail

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists()
        Checks if this Move has a move file in the movements folder. The move file has the same name as the Move with added move file specific ending.
        Specified by:
        fileExists in class Saver
        Returns:
        true if the file exists, false otherwise
        See Also:
        MoveEditor, Constant.MOVES_DIR, Constant.MOVE_END

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile()
                throws SecurityException,
                       IllegalArgumentException,
                       FileCreationException,
                       FileRenameException,
                       IOException,
                       VariableStateException,
                       DuplicateVariableNameException
        Writes the variables and name of the Move of this MoveSaver to file. Doesn't allow a blank-named Move to be saved. If the Move was loaded from file, checks if the name was changed and renames move files and folders. After successful saving, informs the MoveListContainerUpdater of the made changes.
        Specified by:
        saveToFile in class Saver
        Throws:
        IOException - when the file cannot be created or opened or if an error occurs during writing
        FileRenameException - when the file to be renamed doesn't exist (user deleted it), the file and rename target both exist (user set Move name same as one that is saved) or renaming failed for unknown reasons
        FileCreationException - when the creation of the move folder fails for unknown reasons
        IllegalArgumentException - when the name of the Move is blank (user trying to save a new Move without changing name or changed name to blank)
        VariableStateException - when any of the variables is not proper
        DuplicateVariableNameException - when two variables are found to have the same name
        SecurityException
        See Also:
        Move, Variable.checkState(), VariableList.checkVariables(), MoveEditor, Constant.MOVES_DIR, Constant.MOVE_END
